title: Match derivative values to function behavior

content.description: The function f is increasing on the interval [1, 3] and nowhere else. The first derivative of f, f', is continuous for all real numbers.
content.question: Which of the following could be a table of values for f'(x) ?

choices.label: The figure shows a table with 2 columns and 6 rows. The first row contains the column labels, from left to right: column one, x; column two, f prime (x). From top to bottom, the data is as follows: Row two: x, 0; f prime (x), negative 1. Row three: x, 1; f prime (x), 0. Row four: x, 2; f prime (x), 2. Row five: x, 3; f prime (x), 0. Row six: x, 4; f prime (x), negative 2.

The figure shows a table with 2 columns and 6 rows. The first row contains the column labels, from left to right: column one, x; column two, f prime (x). From top to bottom, the data is as follows: Row two: x, 0; f prime (x), negative 1. Row three: x, 1; f prime (x), 1. Row four: x, 2; f prime (x), 2. Row five: x, 3; f prime (x), 1. Row six: x, 4; f prime (x), negative 2.

Row six: x, 4; f prime (x), 0.

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
